item.title: Hell is Us and Styx publisher Nacon files for insolvency
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr,

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

February 25, 2026

1 Min Read

Logo and artwork via Nacon

French publisher and peripheral manufacturer Nacon has filed for insolvency before the Commercial Court of Lille Metropole.

The company, which has published titles such as Hell is Us and and Styx: Blades of Greed, intends to commence judicial reorganization proceedings so it can continue operating, renegotiate its debts, and table a "credible and effective" continuation plan. 

Nacon is a subsidiary of Bigben Group, which failed to partially repay a bond loan earlier this month due to what it described as "an unexpected and late refusal by its banking pool." 

As a result, Nacon is now looking to restructure its own debt under court supervision. 

"The aim of this procedure is to assess all possible solutions to ensure the sustainability of the Company's activity under the best possible conditions, protect employees, and preserve jobs, while renegotiating with its creditors in a calm and constructive framework," said Nacon is a note to investors.

Related:'We failed at our most basic job:' Discord delays age verification rollout

Nacon said it informed employee representative organizations of the situation on February 24, 2026. It noted that judicial reorganization proceedings can last up to 18 months and will result in its existing liabilities being frozen for that period. 

The company currently employs over 1,000 workers across 25 subsidiaries, including 16 development studios. Its distribution network encompasses 100 countries. 

Nacon said it will keep the market informed as the situation develops. A court will rule on its request during a hearing expected in early March.
